content: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: from all I've read, an Executive Order is a possibility I'm not comfortable with that at all. If it's a federal law then congress needs to change it. I just don't like Executive Orders being used to go around congress. They have their place, but not in a case like this. I agree with this sentiment, and perhaps it is one of the reasons that the prospect of an EO is not seriously discussed. It would be disingenuous to lambast the former President for his signing statements while simultaneously ignoring federal law by issuing a contradictory Executive Order. One thing that bothers me is the kid glove treatment of this issue. Everyone brings up what happened to President Clinton when he approached the issue, but no one looks at the cause for his failure - Senator Nunn. It was a personal contest of wills between Senator Nunn, who was mad at having his intended bid for the presidency unseated before it began by this upstart Clinton guy, and Clinton, a newcomer to Washington who badly fumbled the public relations war that consumed the Senate. Where is the prominent Democrat committee chairman that has the motivation and the power to derail President Obama's push on this issue? Doesn't exist. He would succeed with a surprisingly low level of fuss if he would just do it. We'd wind up with a few op eds and angry commercials, and then it would be done with, and the military - and the country - would be better (and safer) for it.
